title: why is swapping out secondary runes so fucking counterintuitive
body: I click on what I want to swap out and it swaps out the other one instead. I try it the other way and it still swaps out the undesired rune.

replies.body: It's the world's dumbest system, but whichever one's in the top slot is always the one that will be swapped out. It's one of those little quality of life things Riot ignores.

If this is true, this is a whole new level of incompetence, especially for Riot who has virtually unlimited money to hire the best of the best programmers, who did they hire? Some wannabe beginner programmer straight out of high school?

They don't have virtually unlimited money. They aren't Bill Gates or one of those Saudi oil tycoons that casually buys several islands at a time, they're a company. People have to be paid, servers have to be upkept, money has to go to R&D for new champion and skin designs. Hell, they might even offer scholarships or donate some of their funds to charity.

The point is, they have a lot of money coming in, yes, but not all of it is available to, say, pull a programmer away from EA, Bethesda, 2K, and some of the other gaming companies out there. Not when those companies might have _more_ money.

It should definitely be fixed though. It's annoying beyond all belief.

It's likely a technical thing, I'd guess that they change runes out of their data object via an iterator, which would result in FIFO (first in first out) behavior without a fair amount of overhead, rather than having an empty data field, or having to track which filled field you need to ignore, for which ever of the 3 categories of secondary runes you don't pick.
